meanings.definition: The tough outer coat of a spore.
meanings.sent1: The exosporia protected the spore from harm.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the exosporia of different spores under a microscope.
meanings.sent3: The exosporia of the spore was so strong, it could withstand extreme temperatures.
meanings.sent4: The exosporia acted like a shield, guarding the spore within.
meanings.sent5: The exosporia was like a suit of armor for the spore, keeping it safe.

meanings.definition: The outermost layer of a spore.
meanings.sent1: Under the microscope, the exosporia of the spore was visible.
meanings.sent2: The exosporia of the spore helped in its dispersal.
meanings.sent3: The exosporia of the spore seemed to shimmer in the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: The exosporia was like a protective shell for the spore.
meanings.sent5: The exosporia was the first line of defense for the spore, keeping it safe from harm.
